explanation: The report is correct. In a build where _WIN32 and _WIN32_WINNT >= 0x0600 are defined, the preprocessor leaves the literal `if (1) return ...;` in the function. That condition is a compile-time constant true, so the return is unconditional at runtime for that configuration and all statements that follow in the same translation unit are unreachable in that build. MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code in the project, so the situation described is a violation for that build configuration. (To fix this, avoid the constant condition — e.g. use preprocessor selection to make the return the only Windows path or restructure the control flow so no later statements become dead/unreachable.)
